alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:17AM HST until January 09 at 8:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Maui in Maui County * Until 815 AM HST. * At 517 AM HST, local law enforcement reported road closure on S Kihei Road near Kaonoulu St due to heavy rain. Radar indicated rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kihei, Kula, Keokea, Pukalani, Ulupalakua, Makawao, Wailea, Kaupo, Makena, Kipahulu, Maalaea, Hana, Waikapu, Haleakala National Park and Hamoa. This warning may need to be extended beyond 815 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
